segment.source: Driver Verification
segment.target: Driver Verification

segment.source: Driver Verification
segment.target: Driver Verification

segment.source: Driver Verification
segment.target: Driver Verification

segment.source: The Driver Verification assessment verifies that an offline Windows image or a running Windows operating system contains the correct set of drivers.
segment.target: The Driver Verification assessment verifies that an offline Windows image or a running Windows operating system contains the correct set of drivers.

segment.source: The results include recommendations to help you resolve any issues that the assessment finds.
segment.target: The results include recommendations to help you resolve any issues that the assessment finds.

segment.source: These issues may include missing, duplicate, older, or unnecessary drivers.
segment.target: These issues may include missing, duplicate, older, or unnecessary drivers.

segment.source: For more information about results and issues, see Results for the Driver Verification Assessment.
segment.target: For more information about results and issues, see Results for the Driver Verification Assessment.

segment.source: The Driver Verification assessment can be used to:
segment.target: The Driver Verification assessment can be used to:

segment.source: Find device and driver issues without using Device Manager.
segment.target: Find device and driver issues without using Device Manager.

segment.source: Find missing device drivers in either a Windows image or a running operating system.
segment.target: Find missing device drivers in either a Windows image or a running operating system.

segment.source: Find driver issues before you deploy an image to a computer.
segment.target: Find driver issues before you deploy an image to a computer.

segment.source: Find software drivers that are not associated with any hardware devices.
segment.target: Find software drivers that are not associated with any hardware devices.

segment.source: The following graphic illustrates the assessment process.
segment.target: The following graphic illustrates the assessment process.

segment.source: workflow graphic for driver verification
segment.target: workflow graphic for driver verification

segment.source: In this topic:
segment.target: In this topic:

segment.source: System Requirements
segment.target: System Requirements

segment.source: Settings
segment.target: Settings

segment.source: System requirements
segment.target: System requirements

segment.source: The first-run help tips in Windows 8.1 can negatively affect assessment results.
segment.target: The first-run help tips in Windows 8.1 can negatively affect assessment results.

segment.source: To disable these, run the following command from an elevated command prompt, and reboot the computer:
segment.target: To disable these, run the following command from an elevated command prompt, and reboot the computer:

segment.source: You can run this assessment on the following operating systems:
segment.target: You can run this assessment on the following operating systems:

segment.source: Windows 8
segment.target: Windows 8

segment.source: Windows 10
segment.target: Windows 10

segment.source: Supported architectures include x86-based, x64-based, and ARM-based systems.
segment.target: Supported architectures include x86-based, x64-based, and ARM-based systems.

segment.source: There are two ways to run this assessment on Windows RT:
segment.target: There are two ways to run this assessment on Windows RT:

segment.source: Package the assessment job in the Windows Assessment Console and then run it on Windows RT.
segment.target: Package the assessment job in the Windows Assessment Console and then run it on Windows RT.

segment.source: For additional information about this option, see Package a job and run it on another computer.
segment.target: For additional information about this option, see Package a job and run it on another computer.

segment.source: Use Windows Assessment Services to run assessments on Windows RT.
segment.target: Use Windows Assessment Services to run assessments on Windows RT.

segment.source: For more information, see Windows Assessment Services.
segment.target: For more information, see Windows Assessment Services.

segment.source: Settings
segment.target: Settings

segment.source: By default, this assessment uses the recommended settings.
segment.target: By default, this assessment uses the recommended settings.

segment.source: Microsoft defines these settings so that you can compare the results across multiple computer configurations or over time on the same computer.
segment.target: Microsoft defines these settings so that you can compare the results across multiple computer configurations or over time on the same computer.

segment.source: When you review the results, the run information includes metadata that indicates whether the assessment used the recommended settings.
segment.target: When you review the results, the run information includes metadata that indicates whether the assessment used the recommended settings.

segment.source: You can also customize the settings if you want to gather data that's different from what the assessment captures by default.
segment.target: You can also customize the settings if you want to gather data that's different from what the assessment captures by default.

segment.source: For example, you might identify specific data that can help you perform a detailed analysis of a particular aspect of the computer.
segment.target: For example, you might identify specific data that can help you perform a detailed analysis of a particular aspect of the computer.

segment.source: The following table describes the assessment settings, recommended setting values, and alternative values for each setting.
segment.target: The following table describes the assessment settings, recommended setting values, and alternative values for each setting.

segment.source: Setting
segment.target: Setting

segment.source: Description
segment.target: Description

segment.source: Use recommended settings
segment.target: Use recommended settings

segment.source: Specifies whether the assessment uses the recommended settings.
segment.target: Specifies whether the assessment uses the recommended settings.

segment.source: By default, this check box is selected.
segment.target: By default, this check box is selected.

segment.source: To change the settings for this assessment, you must first clear this check box.
segment.target: To change the settings for this assessment, you must first clear this check box.

segment.source: Devices Input Path
segment.target: Devices Input Path

segment.source: Specifies a path to a Device.xml file that contains an inventory of all the devices on the computer.
segment.target: Specifies a path to a Device.xml file that contains an inventory of all the devices on the computer.

segment.source: By default, no path is provided and device information is collected from the computer that the assessment is running on.
segment.target: By default, no path is provided and device information is collected from the computer that the assessment is running on.

segment.source: If you provide a path to a Device.xml file, the device information in the file will be used instead.
segment.target: If you provide a path to a Device.xml file, the device information in the file will be used instead.

segment.source: Silent Console
segment.target: Silent Console

segment.source: Specifies whether the job runs silently (without a console UI).
segment.target: Specifies whether the job runs silently (without a console UI).

segment.source: This is the default behavior.
segment.target: This is the default behavior.

segment.source: Write Devices.xml
segment.target: Write Devices.xml

segment.source: Specifies whether a Devices.xml file that contains an inventory of all the devices on the computer, should be generated.
segment.target: Specifies whether a Devices.xml file that contains an inventory of all the devices on the computer, should be generated.

segment.source: By default, this check box is cleared and the file is not generated.
segment.target: By default, this check box is cleared and the file is not generated.

segment.source: If you select this check box, a Devices.xml file is saved to the local computer in the assessment results folder, for later use.
segment.target: If you select this check box, a Devices.xml file is saved to the local computer in the assessment results folder, for later use.

segment.source: Write Driver.xml
segment.target: Write Driver.xml

segment.source: Specifies whether a Drivers.xml file, that lists the drivers found on the computer, is generated or not.
segment.target: Specifies whether a Drivers.xml file, that lists the drivers found on the computer, is generated or not.

segment.source: By default, this check box is cleared, and the file is not generated.
segment.target: By default, this check box is cleared, and the file is not generated.

segment.source: If you select this check box, a Drivers.xml file is saved to the local computer in the assessment results folder for later use.
segment.target: If you select this check box, a Drivers.xml file is saved to the local computer in the assessment results folder for later use.

segment.source: Mounted Image Path
segment.target: Mounted Image Path

segment.source: Specifies the full path to a mounted Windows image if you want to run the assessment against an offline Windows image.
segment.target: Specifies the full path to a mounted Windows image if you want to run the assessment against an offline Windows image.

segment.source: By default, this box is empty and the assessment evaluates the drivers on the running operating system.
segment.target: By default, this box is empty and the assessment evaluates the drivers on the running operating system.
